meanings.definition: Something that completes or makes perfect.
meanings.sent1: The dessert was the perfect complement to the meal.
meanings.sent2: The scarf was a nice complement to her outfit.
meanings.sent3: The music was a great complement to the party atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a complement that brightened everyone's day.
meanings.sent5: The colorful flowers were a beautiful complement to the garden.

meanings.definition: A number or quantity needed to make a group complete.
meanings.sent1: We need one more player to have a full complement for the game.
meanings.sent2: The team had a full complement of supplies for the mission.
meanings.sent3: The missing ingredient was the final complement needed for the recipe.
meanings.sent4: Each member of the group was a vital complement to the project.
meanings.sent5: The last puzzle piece was the missing complement to the picture.

meanings.definition: To add to something in a way that enhances or improves it.
meanings.sent1: The red shoes complemented her dress perfectly.
meanings.sent2: Adding cinnamon will complement the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent3: His witty remarks always complement the conversation.
meanings.sent4: The new artwork really complements the room decor.
meanings.sent5: The fresh herbs will complement the taste of the soup.
